title: How to Make a PVC Folding Chair

steps.headline: Fold and sew 2.5 inch casing on each side.
steps.description:
It should fit the PVC pipe. This will the seat for the folding chair. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":320,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"506","licensing":"

steps.headline: Prepare and cut your PVCs into size.
Find the center of all the four 13 "inch PVC pipes.
Drill a hole in the middle of each 13" inch PVC pipe.
steps.description:
Paint the pipes to your liking. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Thread the seat through one 7"inch top piece and one 10"inch top piece.
Form two rectangles using the 13" inch pipes,  with one with a 10" inch pipe top and bottom and one with a 7" inch pipe top and bottom.
Cross the two rectangles and align them on each drilled holes.
Connect them using nuts and bolts.
You're done!
steps.description:
You can fold and store it. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

text:
Choose your fabric. Cut it 7 by 18 inches. Fold and sew 2.5 inch casing on each side. It should fit the PVC pipe. This will the seat for the folding chair. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":320,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"506","licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Prepare and cut your PVCs into size. Find the center of all the four 13 "inch PVC pipes. Drill a hole in the middle of each 13" inch PVC pipe. Paint the pipes to your liking. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/03/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Thread the seat through one 7"inch top piece and one 10"inch top piece. Attached the four 13" inch pipes. Form two rectangles using the 13" inch pipes, with one with a 10" inch pipe top and bottom and one with a 7" inch pipe top and bottom. Cross the two rectangles and align them on each drilled holes. Connect them using nuts and bolts. You're done! You can fold and store it. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"}
sentences: Fold and sew 2.5 inch casing on each side.
It should fit the PVC pipe.
This will the seat for the folding chair.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bc\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":320,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"506","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Prepare and cut your PVCs into size.
Find the center of all the four 13 "inch PVC pipes.
Drill a hole in the middle of each 13" inch PVC pipe.
Paint the pipes to your liking.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/03\/Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid5469828-v4-728px-Make-a-PVC-Folding-Chair-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Thread the seat through one 7"inch top piece and one 10"inch top piece.
Form two rectangles using the 13" inch pipes,  with one with a 10" inch pipe top and bottom and one with a 7" inch pipe top and bottom.
Cross the two rectangles and align them on each drilled holes.
Connect them using nuts and bolts.
You can fold and store it.
